Uses of Class
Server.ConnectionHandler

  • Packages that use ConnectionHandler 
    Package Description
    Server  

    • Uses of ConnectionHandler in Server

      Methods in Server that return types with arguments of type ConnectionHandler 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<ConnectionHandler> GameController.getPlayers()
      Returns the players associated with this GameController
      Methods in Server with parameters of type ConnectionHandler 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void ServerController.addConnectionHandler(java.lang.String nickName, ConnectionHandler newPlayer)
      Adds a ConnectionHandler to the Connections Map
      void ServerController.addSecurityPlayer(ConnectionHandler player)
      Because of AMULET the security players need to be added separately.
      int GameController.convertHandlerToInt(ConnectionHandler player)
      Returns the Integer representation of the ConnectionHandler Object because the Game class uses integers.
      void GameController.endGame(ConnectionHandler clientToBeTerminated)
      Handles properly ending the game if the game ends with a player being kicked.
      void ServerController.matchExtensions(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> extensions, ConnectionHandler player)
      Because of the AMULET protocol the extensions which a client supports must be kept track of.
      void GameController.newMove(ConnectionHandler playerHandler, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> arguments)
      Handles the AMULET protocol for doing a move If the player isn't on turn or the move is illegal It pulls the integer of the column of the move from the AMULET arguments list it is handed by the ConnectionHandler that calls the method and parses it to a String.
      void ServerController.removeConnectionHandler(ConnectionHandler removePlayer)
      Removes a ConnectionHandler from the Connections Map.
      void ServerController.startChallangeGame(ConnectionHandler player1, ConnectionHandler player2)
      Creates a GameController object which starts a game with players player1 and player2 Used when both players are known.
      void ServerController.startGame(ConnectionHandler player1)
      This methods handles the situation when there is a new player without challenge capabilities It looks for any other players which are not in a game and selects one randomly It puts them both in a GameController and assigns the GameController to their respective gameController Attributes
      Method parameters in Server with type arguments of type ConnectionHandler 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void ServerController.addGame(java.lang.String nameGame, java.util.List<ConnectionHandler> playerList)
      addGame removes the players of a new game from the ActivePlayers map and puts a new entry into the games map.
      Constructors in Server with parameters of type ConnectionHandler 
      Constructor and Description
      GameController(ConnectionHandler newPlayer1, ConnectionHandler newPlayer2)
      Starts a new Game with two players.
